meanings.definition: A divine rule or law, especially one given by God.
meanings.sent1: The Ten Commandments are important divine commandments.
meanings.sent2: The commandment to love one another is found in the Bible.
meanings.sent3: The commandment to always eat dessert first would make life very sweet!
meanings.sent4: The commandment to treat others as you want to be treated is a golden rule.
meanings.sent5: The commandment to always tell the truth is a moral compass for many people.

meanings.sent1: The king's commandment was to prepare for battle.
meanings.sent2: The teacher's commandment to study hard was taken seriously by the students.
meanings.sent3: The commandment to wear a silly hat every Tuesday made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The coach's commandment to never give up inspired the team to victory.
meanings.sent5: The boss's commandment to always be on time was followed by all employees.
